ygData.subject: Message Issues
ygData.msgSnippet: Bah, for some reason Yahoo Groups spam filter is being more aggressive recently, and it s putting an increasing number of messages in a moderator-controlled

Subject: Message Issues
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=183620858; y=lvOOc-1Ng6P5O4geb3TA2vqxr-NpRvTPxT_cadQCtKbhcaY
X-Yahoo-Profile: blue5432

Bah, for some reason Yahoo Groups' spam filter is being more
aggressive recently, and it's putting an increasing number of messages
in a moderator-controlled holding pen for approval. Ken Lloyd's last
two messages and Kirk's last message were all held pending moderator
approval because of suspected spam.

This shouldn't be an issue, because this list requires
moderator-approved membership, so I'd rather spam just go through,
which would simply allow me to boot any account sending spam. If
anything, the spam filter should be very relaxed. Also, stupidly, the
spam filter doesn't have a "NOT SPAM" indicator for non-spam messages,
so it doesn't appear to have a corrective method for identifying good
messages.

I'll see if there's anything I can do to remedy the situation, but it
just may be crappy design on Yahoo's part. A couple of suggestions for
posting:

1) Try to limit the amount of quoted text in your messages. If
advertisements are hanging on the end of long strings of quoted text,
this may be causing problems for the spam filter.

2) Avoid signatures...they shouldn't cause spam issues, but that might
be doing it.

3) E-mail me directly at djames@... if your posted message
doesn't go through within 24 hours. Messages are sometimes delayed,
but one should never be delayed over a day.

Sorry for the problems...but keep up the conversation. :)

--Derek
